content:
TextDecoration Class

Definition

Represents a text decoration, which a visual ornamentation that is added to text (such as an underline).

In this Article

[System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.None)]
public sealed class TextDecoration : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable

DependencyObject

Animatable

Remarks

There are four types of text decorations: underline, baseline, strikethrough, and overline. The following example shows the locations of the text decorations relative to the text.


Example of text decoration types

The following example shows a text decoration that has been styled with a linear gradient brush and a dashed pen.


Example of an underline styled with a linear gradient brush and dashed pen

Notice that TextDecoration is derived from Animatable. This makes it possible to apply animated effects to the decoration elements, using a DoubleAnimation for the PenOffset and a ThicknessAnimation for the Pen.

Constructors

TextDecoration()

Initializes a new instance of the TextDecoration class.

public TextDecoration ();

Remarks

The default value of the Location property is TextDecorationLocation.

TextDecoration(TextDecorationLocation, Pen, Double, TextDecorationUnit, TextDecorationUnit)

Initializes a new instance of the TextDecoration class with the specified stem.Windows.TextDecoration.Location*, stem.Windows.TextDecoration.Pen*, stem.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffset*, stem.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffsetUnit*, and stem.Windows.TextDecoration.PenThicknessUnit* values.

public TextDecoration (System.Windows.TextDecorationLocation location, System.Windows.Media.Pen pen, double penOffset, System.Windows.TextDecorationUnit penOffsetUnit, System.Windows.TextDecorationUnit penThicknessUnit);
Parameters
location
TextDecorationLocation

The location of the text decoration.

pen
Pen

The Pen used to draw the text decoration. If this value is null, the text decoration color matches the text color to which it is applied, and the text decoration's thickness is set to the font's recommended thickness.

penOffset
Double

The vertical displacement from the text decoration's location. A negative value moves the decoration lower, while a positive value moves the decoration higher.

penOffsetUnit
TextDecorationUnit

The units used to interpret the value of penOffset.

penThicknessUnit
TextDecorationUnit

The units used to interpret the value of the stem.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness* for the pen.

PenThicknessUnitProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.TextDecoration.PenThicknessUnit* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty PenThicknessUnitProperty;

Properties

Location

Gets or sets the vertical location at which the text decoration is drawn.

public System.Windows.TextDecorationLocation Location { get; set; }
Value
TextDecorationLocation

The vertical location at which the text decoration is drawn.

Remarks

The following example shows the locations of the text decorations relative to the text.


Example of text decoration types

The PenOffset property enables you to offset the text decoration from the specified Location.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field LocationProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Pen

Gets or sets the Pen used to draw the text decoration.

public System.Windows.Media.Pen Pen { get; set; }
Value
Pen

The Pen used to draw the text decoration. If this value is null, the decoration color matches the text to which it is applied and the decoration's thickness is set to the font's recommended thickness.

Remarks

The following example shows a text decoration that has been styled with a linear gradient brush and a dashed pen.


Example of an underline styled with a linear gradient brush and dashed pen

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field PenProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

PenOffset

Gets or sets the text decoration's offset from its stem.Windows.TextDecoration.Location*.

public double PenOffset { get; set; }
Value
Double

The text decoration's offset from its stem.Windows.TextDecoration.Location*. The default is 0.

Remarks

A negative value moves the text decoration higher, while a positive value moves the text decoration lower. Use the PenOffsetUnit property to specify how the units of this value are interpreted.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field PenOffsetProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

PenOffsetUnit

Gets the units in which the stem.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffset* value is expressed.

public System.Windows.TextDecorationUnit PenOffsetUnit { get; set; }
Value
TextDecorationUnit

The units in which the stem.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffset* value is expressed. The default is TextDecorationUnit.

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field PenOffsetUnitProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

PenThicknessUnit

Gets the units in which the stem.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness* of the text decoration's stem.Windows.TextDecoration.Pen* is expressed.

public System.Windows.TextDecorationUnit PenThicknessUnit { get; set; }
Value
TextDecorationUnit

The units in which the stem.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness* of the text decoration's stem.Windows.TextDecoration.Pen* is expressed. The default is TextDecorationUnit.

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field PenThicknessUnitProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this TextDecoration, making deep copies of this object's values.

public System.Windows.TextDecoration Clone ();
Returns
TextDecoration

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this TextDecoration object, making deep copies of this object's current values.

public System.Windows.TextDecoration CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
TextDecoration

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property value is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property value is true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

CreateInstanceCore() 

protected override System.Windows.Freezable CreateInstanceCore ();
Returns
Freezable
